ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Setting of task
Notes: e.g., behavioral, in scanner, online/at home, at computer lab, etc.

ElementDescription: session details
Task version
Notes: 1 = Shock; 2 = Reward-gain; 3= Reward-loss; 4 = Version 1; 5 = Version 2; 6= Version 3

ElementDescription: Task order
Magnitude of left urn
Magnitude of right urn
Whether trial is ambiguous or not
Side of pseudo-ambiguous urn assigned in non-ambiguous trial (used for modeling)
Notes: For non-ambiguous trials, one side is randomly assigned as ''ambiguous'' for modeling purposes (assignment is counterbalanced); 99=Does not apply (indicates ambiguous trial)

ElementDescription: Number of ''x'' tokens shown in left urn
Notes: The number of ''x'' and ''o'' will sum to less than 50 if urn is ambiguous

ElementDescription: Number of ''o'' tokens shown in left urn
Notes: The number of ''x'' and ''o'' will sum to less than 50 if urn is ambiguous

ElementDescription: Number of ''x'' tokens shown in right urn
Notes: The number of ''x'' and ''o'' will sum to less than 50 if urn is ambiguous

ElementDescription: Number of ''o'' tokens shown in right urn
Notes: The number of ''x'' and ''o'' will sum to less than 50 if urn is ambiguous

ElementDescription: Ambiguity Task - Side of urn chosen
Notes: left= Chose left urn; right= Chose right urn

ElementDescription: Ambiguity Task - Outcome stored for trial
Notes: 0= ''o'' was drawn, null outcome stored (in-lab version) or given immediately (online version) for this trial; 1= ''x'' was drawn, choice magnitude was stored (in-lab version) or given immediately (online version) for this trial

ElementDescription: Ambiguity Task - Magnitude drawn every 6 trials from previous 6 stored outcomes
Ambiguity Task - Response time (ms)
Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Trial number
